cab.content: With reference to the Memorandum of the 3rd November 1917 (G.T.-2625) presented by the Minister of Munitions to the War Cabinet on the subject of Military Labour, I am informed by the members of the Railway Executive Com-mittee that they thoroughly agree with the views expressed In the Memorandum prepared by Sir Charles Ellis, Sir Ernest Moir, and Colonel Hawkins. In the opinion of the Committee it is absolutely essential that some labour force must be available tc assist in cases of emergency or pressure for dealing with traffic in congested areas and ports.A.H. STANLEY, 26th November, 1917.
